intro: Muellerina flexialabastra, commonly known as the slender muellerina, is a species of flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its small, narrow leaves and produces clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in sandy soils and is found in coastal regions of Western Australia. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
